metadata.title: The Ethical Crossroads
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: You sense that something is ethically wrong inside the company — unexplained numbers, whispers in the hallway, and mounting pressure. Your decisions reveal your integrity, courage, and how you balance truth, safety, and harmony.
metadata.hint: Tests Integrity mindset, Courage in judgment, Harmony preference, and Risk mindset

dimensions.label: Risk mindset
dimensions.description: How you approach danger, exposure, and personal consequences

dimensions.label: Clarity mindset
dimensions.description: How you interpret signals, verify facts, and pursue truth

dimensions.label: Courage / integrity
dimensions.description: How strongly you stand by values under pressure

dimensions.label: Harmony & relational awareness
dimensions.description: How much you prioritize peace, relationships, and emotional signals

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: Rumor in the Hallway
scenes.body:
A teammate leans close and whispers: “Finance might be hiding losses from last quarter.”

The hallway feels heavier than usual. This could be nothing… or the start of something serious.
scenes.tip: Your first instinct reveals how you face uncertain truth.

options.label: D
options.main: Ask why they’re telling YOU specifically.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: The Suspicious File
scenes.body: Later, you see a folder on the shared drive: “Adjustments – Internal”. The timing feels suspicious.
scenes.tip: This reveals whether you avoid or investigate sensitive signals.

options.label: B
options.main: Ask finance casually about the folder.
options.desc: You test the waters through dialogue.

options.label: C
options.main: Screenshot it and save for later proof.

options.label: D
options.desc: You prefer not to get involved.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: Your Manager Approaches
scenes.body:
Your manager overhears you near finance. They pause: “Everything okay?”

It’s unclear whether they know something… or suspect you do.
scenes.tip: Your answer determines whether you reveal or conceal uncertainty.

options.label: B
options.desc: You keep your distance from conflict.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: Finance Director Calls You In
scenes.body:
Unexpectedly, the finance director asks: “Did you see something you shouldn’t?”

The room feels smaller. They’re watching your reaction carefully.
scenes.tip: This moment tests your integrity under scrutiny.

options.label: C
options.main: Ask them to explain the adjustments.

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: A Colleague Warns You
scenes.body:
A coworker whispers: “Careful. People who dig too deep get burned.”
You sense concern — or fear.
scenes.tip: This choice reveals your relationship with danger and truth.

options.label: A
options.desc: You commit to integrity despite risk.

options.label: D
options.desc: You expand your understanding of the network.

scenes.label: scene6
scenes.title: Shadow You Appears
scenes.body: A faint silhouette — another version of you — whispers: “Integrity is costly. Are you sure you want the truth?”
scenes.tip: Your response defines your ethical identity.

scenes.label: scene7
scenes.title: Final Ethical Fork
scenes.body:
Your path splits into three glowing doors:

SAFE — Stay Silent
SMART — Report Internally
BRAVE — Whistleblow
scenes.tip: Your final choice reveals your ethical archetype.

options.label: A
options.desc: You protect yourself and harmony above truth.

options.label: C
options.desc: You stand boldly for truth, no matter the cost.

growthSuggestions.text: Your analysis is strong, but courage lags. Work on assertive truth-telling.
Harmony drives you — sometimes too much. Develop comfort with ethical conflict.
Your willingness to expose issues is high. Ensure you have emotional and procedural safety nets.
Your ethical stance can weaken under pressure. Practice naming values before making decisions.
You show a developing ethical balance. Continue strengthening clarity, integrity, and courage under ambiguity.
